item.title: Timers - Learning
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

You need to add some internal state somewhere that indicates which stage of loading the client is at, and how much of that stage is complete (e.g., load_stage=ANIMATIONS, stage_progress=8/200 animations). Maybe this exists somewhere else already?

Then your progress view can call this periodically to work out the current progress, using a map that assigns each load stage to a percentage of the overall progress (run your own experiments to work out what these percentages should be). The rate of increase probably wont be very smooth so I’d use an interpolator to make it nice!

@Skyro wrote:

Just playing around with timers and progress bar’s for the first time so very new and just trying to learn from my self.

The following code works, but it doesn’t seem professional as it just adds +5 to the progress bar every 200ms. Is there a way that I can actually make the loading bar take as long as it takes for the client to open and load?

Also, if there’s any constructive criticism. Please, help me. 

JButton btnStartClient = new JButton("Start Client");
		final JProgressBar progressBar = new JProgressBar();
		progressBar.setStringPainted(true);
		btnStartClient.addActionListener(new ActionListener() {
			public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {
				final Timer t = new Timer();
				TimerTask task = new TimerTask() {
					public void run() {
						if (!(progressBar.getValue() == 100)) {
							progressBar.setValue(progressBar.getValue() + 5);
						} else {
							t.cancel();
							if (Configuration.CLIENT_READY == false) {
								JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null,
										"Error, client isn't ready!");
							} else {
								try {
									Class<?> clientClass = getClasses()
											.loadClass(
													Configuration.CLIENT_CLASSPATH);
									applet = (Applet) clientClass.newInstance();
									applet.init();
								} catch (ClassNotFoundException
										| MalformedURLException e1) {
									e1.printStackTrace();
								} catch (InstantiationException e1) {
									e1.printStackTrace();
								} catch (IllegalAccessException e1) {
									e1.printStackTrace();
								}
							}
						}
					}
				};
				t.scheduleAtFixedRate(task, 0, 200);
			}
